My problem with the 4 tests ap=
proach is that if for some reason the public API
for the tests change, I ha=
ve to change n+1 test methods. Whereas if I contain
everything in a single =
test (as I'm doing now) I only have to change it once
when the public API c=
hanges (and yes, it has happened).

> to implement the simpliest tests poss=
ible:
> 
> - use the setUp() method to create your data object
> - create 4=
 tests methods (in my example it's 4)
> - remove one single mendatory field=
 at the beginning of each test method
> - call the fail() method to tell JU=
nit that something wrong happend
> 

I'm just trying to concentrate all tha=
t in one test because I find
Cut'n'Paste to be error prone. In our case, we=
 test data that has 12 or 14
mandatory fields and 3 or 4 optional. Repeatin=
g the exact same code 18 times
screams REFACTORING! And to me a proper refa=
ctoring of such identical tests is
to put it all in one method. I'm just lo=
oking for a friendly way to show 8
failures if 8 of the test cases fail. So=
 far, the best I've come up with is
to create a string with all the names o=
f the fields that have failed and print
them in the fail() call. But it's n=
ot very appealing visually.
